review_title: Great game for VR, but lacking details
one_reviews_text:
I've played the real game with friends and via table top sim, but having this is VR is great. Although its lacking in some areas which could really make this game the one in VR. 

Here is a list of what I think could make this better..

Some character animation would be good, mouth movement when players are talking. 

Dice rolls could be controlled by the player and rolled onto the table. Rather than the computer already RNG'ing the outcome.

More interactivity with the cards and clearer instructions of what cards do what. 

More board animation and details

Hopefully the devs continue work on this and expand on it now we have the quest 2 version.
Love it! Simple but also very detailed. I love those little sheep :) But all my friends have Oculus Quest. Why is this game not for the Quest?! That really sucks!

5 stars = 4 stars with the best graphics 
4 stars = definitely a realy good investment, will spent a lot of time with it
3 stars = works perfectly, would probably even give some money for it
2 stars =good enough to keep it installed and open it from time to time, wouldn't buy it (again)
1 star = wouldn't buy or install it again but did try / didn't work properly

review_title: Well design done game - need some update
one_reviews_text:
UPDATE : 

The admin on discord will ban you for nothing, be careful.

-----------------------------------------------------------
----------------------------------------------------------

Had this game for chritmas cause I played IRL sometime and it's really good, there is a community with some competition on discord.

It would be good to have the devs listenning to our feedback and had want we want for the game to be even better but w/e.

This game is great!  If you like board games it is a must have.  The multiplayer community for this game has increased since oculus go and PSVR support has been added.  If you are looking for players to play with, the best place to find players is on the Catan VR League discord where we have friendy competitive games and also fun games, then you can join the discord through the website https://catanvr.club/ and there are players at all times of the day looking for games.  As well, you can go to the catan VR discord server https://discord.gg/A8WpAKq (Experiment 7 is the name of developer and name of discord server).   The game just has so much polish and the tavern room that is the background looks so great and there is also like a Japan style room too.  The game itself plays perfectly and I have only noticed like one minor bug that happens and I will tell you how to fix it if it happens to you.  If you take your headset off during a game sometimes there is a bug that causes you to lose the ability to communicate (hearing and speaking to others) and the only fix is to leave and come back.  So if you are waiting for a game to start and this happens, leave and come back and it will be fixed.  If you have already started your game, then you must finish your game before you can communicate again.  Now if you are in the later situation, you can still communicate by using the trade windows so the game is still playable just less convenient for that current game.
review_feedback: Glad that you are enjoying it - and thanks for the report. We'll check it out.  :)

one_reviews_text:
love love love.  something to play after all the shooting and puzzle games
when is the next game coming?
one thing I noticed, the AI players seem to be programed to trade with each other first , giving them an advantage
review_feedback: AI players trade with players that treat them well - human and AI. So if you're blocking in a particular AI, not responding to their trades, or are well in the lead, they will not be as eager to trade with you. On the other hand, if you've accepted past trades or aren't competing for locations, they'll treat you as a more preferred partner. Each AI also has a unique personality, one trait of which includes willingness to trade (with all players/AI). Play around with it some - I think you'll find surprising depth.  :)

one_reviews_text: This is one of my favourite VR board games. I think it is the perfect use of relaxing VR.  However, my question is to the developers - is there any intention of taking this further?  There are so many variations of this game in the board game version. Any more VR titles/expansions on the cards? Would love to hear from you. Thanks
review_feedback:
Glad that you're enjoying the game. 

Our goal has been getting this on more hardware (we started on the Rift and Gear, and are now also on the Go, Vive and PSVR). As the VR community size is still modest, we've focused our efforts on hardware ports (with cross-platform play) to help get more players for multiplayer games rather than expansions.

review_title: Wish I could play this on my quest.
one_reviews_text:
It's Catan. It works. It's great. It's cheaper than the real game. Just wish I could play it on my Oculus Quest. 
An amazing game that I already bought from the Oculus store that I wish I could play on my Quest. 

Buy it for Rift. It's worth it. 
Would be my killer app if on the quest.
Still waiting for Cities and knights extension  :)
If you like board games this one is surely for you. I just wish that more players would be online and ready for PVP
review_feedback: Glad that you're enjoying it. To help find more people, try joining our Discord here: https://discord.gg/A8WpAKq

review_title: not a lot of content for the money
one_reviews_text: The Game is good but here is one map only! and it is getting boring after a short time of playing. Please develpers add some more maps or even better some campains !!!!! The other minus is I play a lot in multiplayer mode but I never saw any human opponent in this game.!?!?!? When I see the amount of comments here Im wondering why I never saw someone inside the game!?
review_feedback: Sawtooth, you might want to try using the randomize map button - you can have an infinite variety of boards to play on. Also, if you're having trouble finding human opponents, try joining our Discord here: https://discord.gg/A8WpAKq. A lot of players use Discord to organize their online play.

one_reviews_text:
I never played Catan before but learned it on the fly during the free weekend. I ended up buying it. Catan is an addictive game and there is a good atmosphere to it-- good environments-- although I wouldn't mind a few more environments and a few more avatars (for the AI). The AI avatars have a nice look to them. 

I only give it four stars because- as I only played against the AI, I realized at some point the AI knew what cards I had. No point hiding them at that point. 

The other thing is-- I know this will be controversial, I am not sure the dice rolls are random. In one game I had no settlement bordering the number 11. The 3 AI sure did. 11 has two dots on it, indicating that statistically it wouldn't come up often. Sure enough- almost once per round the number 11 kept being rolled. The next game, I happened to be the 'only' player with a settlement adjacent to 11. I went almost the whole match (hour long?) before I got a hit!!! What are the stats on that? Hundreds of rolls. Before each roll I'd say, "Come on eleven!" and noticed it was never 11 although the prior match it was almost always 11. Whatever, I am sure the game is great with friends. It is fun against the frustrating AI too!

Don't take my word on the dice rolls being crooked-- it's just my unscientific impression. Play the game and decide for yourself.

I recently played Catan on the original board game. Although, I lost two out of three, I had fun playing. So, I thought that I'd give this a try. Having the board set up for you is a plus. The game flows easily enough, except for when it's my turn. 

When the game is won, it doesn't show how. I have to assume it was from victory point cards, but it doesn't show the cards. I counted three cities and the largest army, that's 8 victory points. They had two development cards, but it never showed them. It needs to show ALL of the victory points. There is plenty of room between the edge of the play area and the edge of the game board to show the victory point cards.

It's a solid 4 stars. If they tweak the AI a bit and show ALL of the victory points at the end, it may get changed to 5 stars.

***UPDATE*** In response to the devs reply to my review. After playing the AI a little more, I do find personalities. Predictable personalites. The dice rolls are pretty predictable, too. Whenever I make a good play (not always, but too often to be random), the next AI player rolls a "7", the next AI player then plays a knight card AND rolls a "7" and the final "7" of the round is rolled by the last AI player. Yes, I am frequently cleaned out of up to four cards. Some form of this happens nearly every game. Also, nothing was mentioned about the showing of the Victory Point Cards to show how the victory happened. Please put some attention on these issues and you'll get a "5" rating from me. Otherwise, a solid "4" rating.
review_feedback:
Hello Slick, glad that you're enjoying the game.
Our AI acts a lot like human players - they tend to remember and play favorably towards those who have made favorable plays (trade, settlement location, etc.) to them, and to play unfavorably towards those who have made unfavorable plays to them. They also, like humans, tend to be a bit more aggressive to players in the lead. (this is reset each game - unlike humans, they don't have meta memory that stretches between games)
That being said, each of the AI's has their own unique personality that sits on top of this, with variants around generosity, expansionist tendencies, preference for development cards, cities, and more. These personality quirks also mimic human player preferences, which is why most players end up with AI's that they like more and those who are great rivals.
As an extra note on trade, AI players, like humans, have wants. If you see an AI that has no access to lumber but is lousy with sheep, you'll probably be able to trade them for sheep but see them unwilling to trade away their hard acquired lumber.

review_title: Fun also with Oculus Go friend
one_reviews_text: We play the real game since years. The more the surprise that this really works and it is almost the same like the real thing. A friend of mine bought Oculus Go, and it works 100% connecting to my Rift. Now we talked a third friends into buying the Oculus Go just because of this game.
review_feedback: Thanks Eulenauge66 - we worked really hard to keep it as close to the original (while optimizing for VR) as we could.

one_reviews_text: Always wanted to play Catan but no none of my friends ever wanted to play it. This is perfect, really relaxing, atmosphere and music in VR are great, game plays well.......now i just need to get good!

review_title: Great game but multiplayer non existant
one_reviews_text: The game is everything you expect it to be and more if you have people to play with. I get stuck waiting in lobbies for long periods at a time not finding a single player. I got really bored of working the AI's and dont want to wait every saturday just to play a decent game. I figured since its cross platform, there would be more players.
review_feedback: UnbrokenVerdict, come join our Discord community here to find more player: https://discord.gg/A8WpAKq. Hopefully as more people buy VR hardware we'll see more players to play online with.

review_title: Great for even new CATAN players
one_reviews_text: I was a complete newbie to CATAN. Found the tutorial sufficient to get started, and learnt the rest  on the go. Fell in love with game!! Playing online matches has been great and shown me the real charm of CATAN. CATAN VR beats flat screen boardgames hands down because you feel transported to a beautiful room sitting with new or old mates having some friendly rivalry fun. It's my favourite game now.
review_feedback: Thanks, we're glad that you're enjoying it!

one_reviews_text:
I bought this game being a huge fan of Civ.  This is a lot shallower than Civ but some of its charm is in its simplicity.   I like the game, it was well worth the money but deep thinking strategy does not play a big part in this , it is largely a game of luck but there are strategic decisions to make. Bear in mind though you may play the perfect strategy and find the roll of the dice is not with you.

The game does not gain much, if anything for being a VR title.  You may as well be playing it on your desktop.  As there is a real shortage of real people to play against perhaps the developers could release a desktop version and allow VR players and Desktop players to pitch against one another ?
review_feedback:
Hello PoolfanVR. This is Geoffrey (Creative Director) writing this, and I'm also a huge fan of Civ (1711 hours on Civ V, 498 on Civ VI so far). 
Randomness has always been an element of Catan, but like other combination dice/strategy games, a lot of Catan is about positioning yourself so that when the dice go your way you can capitalize on the event. If you Google "Catan World Championship" you can find some pretty advanced strategies. 
As VR is a growing technology, we've focused on the device cross-play (Rift to Gear and Go, and soon to Steam/HTC) to get the biggest multiplayer pool that we can. Sadly, we don't have the license for Desktop/Mobile play (that was given to another company before VR commercial hardware existed), so we contractually aren't able to do VR to PC/Mobile. As more people get their hands on VR our matchmaking pools will get better and better - this is one of those things where as a developer there is a limit to what we can do about audience size.
We hope that you enjoy your Catan VR experience!

one_reviews_text: My wife and I have been wanting to play Catan for years, but we've never had much luck with board games because of all the peices and complex rules. The VR version made it easy to learn, and turned both of us into total addicts! We've bought multiple copies for the Rift and Gear VR, and are planning on picking up another Oculus Go headset to play Catan when we're on vacation!
review_feedback: Thanks Christopheritter - glad that you two are enjoying it!

one_reviews_text: Solid game with good controls. Lots of fun to play with friends. If you're playing single player the AI seems to pick on you a little, but it's still fun. Would love to see some more customization options in the future (more masks, buildings, paintings, etc.) and the cherry on top would be expanded tile sets (Star Trek Catan, etc.)
review_feedback: Hey CQQLGUY, each AI has its own personality, and so will respond a bit differently. That being said, they are like people and will react to how you interact with them...  Good luck!

one_reviews_text:
I know, there are some really cool VR games at the moments.  but Catan is more than a Board Game,  its a Social Experience,  i have a blast playing with 2 of my close friends and we have 2 to 3 hours sesions, of pure fun.  i dont regret buying this games, i hope the company makes more Board games like this!! 10/10.
IMPORTANT UPDATE: I found an exploit ingame that i would like to share with the Devs to be revised .  how can i get in conctact with you guys?
review_feedback: Thanks! We really focused on the "social" as well as the "game" part of it - glad that you're enjoying it.  :)

one_reviews_text:
Love it, one of my most used apps, and I wasn't familiar with the game before. Just a couple of minor issues: If you select 'Build Settlement' then change your mind, the 'Cancel' button doesn't work: You *have* to build the settlement or quit the app (UPDATE: Problem fixed!). Also, Candamir wins what seems to be about 95% of the games (ALSO AN UPDATE: I'm fine with this). Even with that it's beautiful, really fun to play even though I still haven't figured out all the little details, the portrait representations of opponents is very unique, and I hope it gets other board games (Ticket to Ride, Monopoly, etc.) translated to VR.

One other thing: Sometimes I'll have all the necessary materials and still can't build a village or city, and don't know why. The tuorial isn't very helpful, so maybe some details on the build screen explaining *why* it's not available to build even though the mats are there, or at least some help / tips built into the game.
review_feedback: Hello McNabb - Each of the AI has a different play style. Lin is my personal nemesis. If you have the necessary materials to build a settlement/city but can't build one, you might want to make sure that you have a valid placement location (a location touching a road and that is at least 2 intersections away from all other settlements/cities). My guess is that that is the scenario you bumped in to.

review_title: Easy to use, but need expansions!
one_reviews_text:
I really love the aspect that you sit around a table with your opponents. This is very easy to use, meaning the controls are point-and-click, you can drag your mini-menu around your FOV, and with touch controls you can play one handed - unless the other hand is occupied by pizza.

BUT I really need to see this game gain the expansions. Seafarers/Cities and Knights would be awesome; If you can find a way to make managing a larger board easy that is.

Played the boardgame, loved it. Played the VR loved it.

No difference really, Devs are very active on Discord and will even join your games when hey have spare time.

Highly recommend

I really like the game but I accidently selected "Exit game" and the whole game was immediately quit without any "Are you sure?" dialogue. There was also no way to continue the game. Edit: Thanks for fixing this!
review_feedback: And thanks for the update!

one_reviews_text: Great potential, but i have never seen another human in the matchmaking. Also the dice rolls, AI decision making, and trading scheme seem questional at best.
review_feedback:
Hello Anorakk. Sadly, we can't do much about the number of people that own VR headsets. However, to facilitate matchmaking, you should join us on on our discord servers here: https://discord.gg/A8WpAKq and/or for Catan Saturdays! 
Not to toot our own horns, but we've also been told that we have the best AI and Trading of any digital Catan game so far. And while we can't please everyone, we'd love for you to leave us feedback on Discord as to the reasons that you're unhappy.

one_reviews_text: As a long term Catan player in real life this comes as close to playing round a table with friends as you can get. The only current problem I have is they need to work on a better way of finding folk to play with. For now the discord link in an earlier review is a reasonable stop gap measure but I think getting people together easily needs to be what they concentrate on next. Having chatted to those developing the game and playing with them as well they come across as having both the passion and commitment to fix the one and only flaw

review_title: You love Catan? You love Catan VR!
one_reviews_text:
as easy as that.
This is a very solid game. Everything is perfect.
review_feedback: Thanks! Enjoy the game.   :)

review_title: Nice conversion of the basic board game
one_reviews_text: It is a nice conversion of the basic board game it taste for more expansions!

review_title: Realy enjoying this. TIME ZONE QUESTION
one_reviews_text: Really enjoying this looking forward to GAME night CATAN  5/17 6 pm but post does not list a time zone I would love some info on that.  I think they should throw a commercial out on this since it is cross paltform.
review_feedback: Hello 18DBLAUGHT. Strangely enough, time zones are not editable by the development team - we will, however, let Oculus know your concern. If you have questions about future game nights our Twitter account (@experiment7inc) always lists the time zone.

one_reviews_text: Surprisingly fun considering the premise.

Excellent VR experience, excellent tutorial & Catan is a brilliant game loved by many & for good reason; I have been tempted by it for years.  
Only a few minor tweaks would make this 5 stars (Some of the cards need clearer contrast, more room options, main menu kept popping up)...hardly anything tbh.
Overall it's bright, colourful, engaging and fun!
P.S: Only the player throwing the dice can make trades :-)
Gameplay Review : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NEjjOqWpnU8
I played this a lot in beta and really enjoy it. So far I have only played against AI but it is a nice relaxing game to play if you feel like sitting down and playing something chill.
to remedy the ai for the solo game
review_feedback: Hello Gildas14 - Not quite sure what you mean by this. We have 6 fantastic (and unique) AI personalities to play against, developed from notes by Klaus Teuber (the game's creator) and our own experience, and then honed by out beta community. We think this is probably the best Catan AI to ever ship with a game!

one_reviews_text: Really love the game, been playing it all day.  Any plans to expand?  Love to see the 5-6 player expansion to the big board, knights and merchants, or even custom rules, like increasing the VP's for a longer game....  Wonderful addition!  Love to see a Talisman remake with this engine!!!!

review_title: So glad this is in VR
one_reviews_text: I too was happy to be able to test this game out during the beta. I picked it up first day. The only bad things so far I can tell you is the fireworks at the end of the game are kinda lame. There should be some sounds. Also, the matchmaking is weak, but just join up to the Discord server and you can find folks to play with. https://discord.gg/9DpFwbE
review_feedback: Thanks for the feedback Puppetts11 - we'd left sound off the fireworks as we thought it might be distracting while people talk post-game. That being said, since we've heard this from a few of our users, we might add some sound to them. [Update] And it should be in the next patch. [Update] And it is live in the game.

one_reviews_text:
I was priveledged to be a part of the beta experience and it was a blast! Best way to play Catan. Even better than playing on a board, because you don't have to setup up or remember to pick up resources. Plus, like to see those visuals made out of carboard!!! HA! 

Grab a VR headset and join in on the fun and maybe we can convince them to make the extensions!

I've been a huge fan of the board game for a long time, so I was super excited to hear about this game. The gameplay itself is solid and really immersive. I especially love the environments and look of the playing board. The only problem I notice is the lack of playerbase, which affects the ability to match with others. But other than that, this is an awesome game and I'm stoked to see it keep improving.
I never played the board game, but it was easy to learn with the tutorial video and a game against AI opponents.  Just enough depth to keep a decent pace and still keep you on your toes.

Overall worth the buy, especially for the price. I'm looking forward to a larger player base for random games, but at least you can play with the AI in the meantime. Minimal tweaking required to make it a completely polished game.
An excellent version of a great game. :-)
Get On Discord ASAP. Youl have the best fun for a long time!
I keep placing roads in the wrong spot. Control scheme is not great.  No online community that I am aware of.  Please update the app and I will update my review.
review_feedback:
Hi RamRaj95,

We're sorry to hear you had a bad experience. One thing that might help is that we have three different control schemes you can try, to see if you can get a better fit (Touch Controls, Laser Pointer and Gaze Controls, accessible through the settings menu). 

Regarding the online community, we have a great group of people on our Discord channel who are waiting to play games! You can find the link to that channel on our website (www.experiment7.com).

Thanks,

Producer Coray

one_reviews_text: Plays great on Rift and GO.
review_feedback: Glad that you're enjoying it!

one_reviews_text: the instructions are bad and used by a computer voice. Go to https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hY2KnwfEBkA to learn how to play.

I am writing this the day the app has released. It is a great app from a gameplay standpoint, but playing with the AI feels like you are being cheated. Red numbers are not rolled as often as you'd think, your opponents will place the robber on your best hex when you are not winning, and one AI player seems to dominate in terms of resource rolls. I was not able to match with anybody after waiting about 5 minutes. If this app becomes popular, it will be by far the best way to virtually play Catan with others.
Wasn't a board game player and rarely used my VR headset. Met the E7 team and fell in love with the concept and game.
